summary:
Spam is a famous canned meat product made by Hormel, first sold in 1937. It's a mix of pork and ham with added ingredients. During World War II, it became popular worldwide and is now sold in many countries.

You can eat Spam straight from the can as it's pre-cooked, but some people prefer to cook it further. However, there are concerns about its high fat content and salt levels.

The name "Spam" has also become famous in popular culture, especially due to a Monty Python sketch, and is now used to describe unwanted emails.
title: Spam (food)
